url = 'https://hub.browserstack.com/wd/hub'
caps = {'app': 'bs://9581df6f6fc7a7eb1dfe7623bf80b90d563ac408', 'automationName': 'XCUITest', 'bstack:options': {'accessKey':...me': 'ios-build', 'projectName': 'mobile-demo', 'sessionName': 'iOS session', ...}, 'deviceName': 'iPhone 15 Pro', ...}

    def _try_create_remote(url, caps):
        """
        Try several ways to call webdriver.Remote to support multiple appium/python-client versions.
        Returns driver on success or raises RuntimeError with detailed tracebacks.
        """
        attempts = []
        last_exc = None
    
        # Attempt 1: desired_capabilities keyword
        try:
            drv = webdriver.Remote(url, desired_capabilities=caps)
            print("SUCCESS: Remote created using desired_capabilities=caps")
            return drv
        except Exception as e:
            attempts.append(("desired_capabilities", traceback.format_exc()))
            last_exc = e
    
        # Attempt 2: positional caps
        try:
            drv = webdriver.Remote(url, caps)
            print("SUCCESS: Remote created using positional caps")
            return drv
        except Exception as e:
            attempts.append(("positional_caps", traceback.format_exc()))
            last_exc = e
    
        # Attempt 3: auth in URL + desired_capabilities
        try:
            auth_url = f"https://{BS_USER}:{BS_KEY}@hub.browserstack.com/wd/hub"
            drv = webdriver.Remote(auth_url, desired_capabilities=caps)
            print("SUCCESS: Remote created using auth in URL + desired_capabilities")
            return drv
        except Exception as e:
            attempts.append(("auth_in_url", traceback.format_exc()))
            last_exc = e
    
        # Attempt 4: selenium.webdriver.Remote fallback
        try:
            from selenium import webdriver as selenium_webdriver
            drv = selenium_webdriver.Remote(command_executor=url, desired_capabilities=caps)
            print("SUCCESS: selenium.webdriver.Remote succeeded")
            return drv
        except Exception as e:
            attempts.append(("selenium_remote", traceback.format_exc()))
            last_exc = e
    
        # If none worked, print tracebacks for debugging and raise
        print("\n--- Driver creation attempts and tracebacks (most recent last) ---")
        for name, tb in attempts:
            print(f"--- Attempt: {name} ---")
            print(tb)
>       raise RuntimeError("All attempts to create Remote driver failed. Last exception: {}".format(repr(last_exc)))
